address: Statue of Dom Sebastiao: Adress Praca Gil Eanes Estátua de Dom Sebastião: Praça Gil Eanes, Lagos 8600-300 Portugal
address_obj/street1: Statue of Dom Sebastiao: Adress Praca Gil Eanes
address_obj/street2: Estátua de Dom Sebastião: Praça Gil Eanes
description: With Lagos free walking tour with local historian, in a fun and relaxed way, With gravures and old photos you can meet the urban evolution of the area and the importance of this town in World history. Will reveal you the history, stories, myths, economy and society. Celtic iron age will be revealed in where they found Lacobriga: The first urban nucleus, objects and way of Living. Found where the Romans settled down, their activities and archaeological finds. The Middle Ages Wall, that was built by the Portuguese From the Modern Era, you will learn from Henry the Navigator, his role in the discovery movement, slaves. The Modern Era wall that today, partially surround the old town and the cemetery of slaves. In this tour you will walk through the path of the Last Convicted to death by a civil crime, in Portugal. Will explain why is King Dom Sebastião statue in our main square. During the tour will Recommend where you can have same traditional dishes, pastry and other Regional gems.
name: Lagos Free Walking Tour With Local Historian
reviews/0/text:
A great way to learn about Lagos town and history with an enthusiastic guide Ligio. We were part of a mixed group with all ages and countries. The 2 1/2 hour tour eventually took 3 hours but it didn’t seem like it as time flew by. 
We’ve been coming to Lagos for over thirty years but we’re advised to take this tour and we are very pleased we did. There’s so much more to the history of this wonderful town/city that we didn’t know about. 
A must for any visitor. 
Also we were given so great recommendations for bars and restaurants some we’ve already used and some we need to try.
reviews/0/title: The only tour you need to take in Lagos
reviews/1/text: Had a nice tour, lots of good information, 2.5 hours seen lots of things, take the tour and learn lots about the area, culture & history.
reviews/2/text:
When you sign up make sure you get Ligio Alves <ligioalves@hotmail.com> as your tour guide. (Contact him directly instead of thru Guru Walks.)All the other reviews say it; he is the best. Passionate and knowledgeable of Lagos, its history and the people that were and are part of it. Very caring of the community and that you get to have a "local's" feel for all of it, the people and the things to do, the street art and more. His recommendations for everything except food were spot on an very helpful. 

For food, he is Portuguese and their tastes are sometime quite different from what many prefer. They like (IMHO) too much salt and not enough other herbs and spices though there is almost always enough garlic and EVOO. But of 4 restaurants he thought highly of we tried only the Ice Cream and Pasteria were places we have gone back too. The two restaurants were at best only enh. 

But we've been to sights and used other tours he thought well of and like his tour we found them to be great. His tour was so good we may do it a second time (to fill in what was missed and friends can get the same perspective we have). The tour is free but he does say a tip is appropriate (and suggests 10 Eu): we were so please we did appreciably more. He really is that good.
reviews/2/title: This is a must to really appreciate Lagos
reviews/3/text: This was a great tour that provided history, funny stories, insights on modern art and local plant life! Would definitely recommend
reviews/3/title: Interesting tour combing new and old
reviews/4/text: It was fantastic:) we learned a lot about Lagos :) even our children enjoyed it :) it was very detailed and we went around all the main attractions.
reviews/5/text: The guide was friendly, knowledgeable, fun and passionate. Had a great time and would definitely recommend it to everyone.
reviews/6/text: Great tour - very informative - different themes -very friendly -with 2,5 h not to short and not to long - and at least tips and recommendations via pdf -
reviews/7/text: Lígio is probably one of the kindest guides I have ever met in my life. His happy disposition, kind personality, little book of pictures and illustrations and extensive knowledge of Lagos' history make this 2-hour tour go by really quick. I really enjoyed his explanation of street art within Lagos and the description of various plants and trees throughout the tour. Great to meet and learn from you, Lígio. Wish you the best! Thank you for showing me around Lagos today.
reviews/7/title: Great tour covering history, street art and more
reviews/8/text:
Very fun and informative Tours about the city of Lagos,  which is a change from the party scene and the beaches. There was a mix between history street art and food & beverages information, which is the perfect mix when you’re visiting a city for the first time.
Ligio was the perfect balance between informative and fun, and backed up all of his comments with Photos and Maps that he had prepared in advance
reviews/9/text: We had a tour with a Portuguese guide. He was really well informed, energetic, and nice. The tour did run 3.5 hours instead of 3, and I was already pooped at 3. (Keep in mind you'll not only be walking but also in the sun--I got a sunburn--and up hills. Be sure to wear shoes that grip slippery pavement, as well as sunscreen or covered clothing.) We also were late, as we stopped at the Free Walking Tour people with the yellow umbrellas, a different tour, instead of looking for the white ones, and they seemed to find us on their list. Anyway, we learned a lot of interesting things about Portuguese history, culture, and architecture. Highly recommend!
reviews/9/title: Well worth it except very tiring
reviews/10/text:
Lígio was a fantastic guide and provided a very informative tour about the history of Lagos.
He also sent us recommendations for local restaurants, bars and other local amenities which was really helpful.
Definitely do this tour in the first few days of your stay as it brought the town to life for us.
reviews/11/text: Our tour guide really knows the history, culture and fun facts- backed by his history degree. It makes this city even more beautiful knowing more about it snd the people. He is proud of his heritage and it is contagious. He answered many questions with honesty and true knowledge.
reviews/11/title: The most interesting and entertaining walking tour by a passionate citizen of lagos. I have been on twice!
reviews/12/text: While on a recent visit to Lagos, I joined Lígio on his walking tour with another participant.  I so enjoyed the tour which brought us all around the old town and the  municipal markets and areas. As a history teacher myself (Ireland) I  found Lígio very well informed with a lovely delivery which was a lovely mix of knowledge, humour and sentiment.  His obvious pride in his city is admirable and to be commended. The tour had three distinctive parts- historical, environmental and artistic.  All three were most interesting.  I particularly enjoyed the old Roman grid pattern area and the construction of the new promenade.  I would heartily recommend this tour and I wish Lígio all of the best for the season. Carmel
reviews/13/text: We did the tour with our young boy and it was interesting also for him for the most part. I would suggest doing the tour as soon as you arrive in Lagos, so you can try the suggested activities and restaurants.
reviews/14/text: Our tour was our favorite of all the other free tours we did on our Portugal Spain trip. Ligio is soooo kind and had an interesting perspective with using old historical photos and the tour was great. He gave great recommendations afterwards too and emailed them out. Went out of the way to find the best winery for me too!
reviews/15/text: Ligio is an engaging, informative, and fun tour guide. Full of local knowledge and history, as well as information on local street art and tips on things to do and places to eat. We really enjoyed this tour.
reviews/16/text: Free walking tours are always the best. Thank you for a great morning. The list of things to do around the area is a bonus too
reviews/17/text: An excellent 2 1/2 hours spent with Ligio as our guide around Lagos. Ligio was brought up here and has a passion for the city and it’s history. Learnt lots of interesting facts and saw things I wouldn’t have noticed on my own. Highly recommended
reviews/17/title: Brilliant 2 hour tour around Lagos with Ligio
reviews/18/text: The guide is fantastic. Very knowledgeable and very interesting. He keeps the history fun and relevant. The tour involves graffiti, murder, fish and 500 year old navigators. It's a lot of fun
reviews/19/text: Ligio gives you a great impression of his hometown, Lagos. A town that has a lot of cultural heritage! Ligio’s english proficiency is very good and he has a lot fun anecdotes about the history and present of Lagos as well. At the end he even provided us with a PDF of all his activity and food recommendations!

address: Albufeira 8200-047 Portugal
description: Hassle-free real private and shared GUIDED TOURS. You are not just another one, but the ONE! Feel SAFE while exploring Portugal. Day Tours - Multi-Day Tours - DayTrip/Transfers.
name: GL Tours
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Wine Tour and Tasting - Semi-Private from Albufeira
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Lagos and Sagres - Semi-Private from Albufeira
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Genuine Algarve- Of the beaten path tour (customized)
offer_group/offer_list/4/title: Faro and Tavira - Private from Albufeira
reviews/0/text:
Gabriel is an outstanding
tour guide. Although the weather was cool and windy, he took us on a wonderful tour through Silves, Carvoeira and along the coast. If you are looking for an outstanding Algarve experience, I highly recommend Gabriel.
reviews/1/text: What more can you say about Gabriel that hasn't been said. Had tours with this man he is well known In the Algarve  for his knowledge humour and dedication to his clients. He recently helped us out and will move mountains to help. Trust him and you will have a wonderful tour tailor-made for you personally.
reviews/2/text:
We were fortunate to book Gabriel at the last minute. We were able to get a single day with him to kick off our first trip to the Algarve. We needed to pack a lot into a short time and Gabriel did it for us without making us feel at all rushed. 
We got an excellent overview of central Algarve communities which started at the best bakery I’ve been in in a very long time, had a great lunch in Faro and wrapped up back at the bakery. 
Gabriel stayed in touch and made recommendations for restaurants and further visits. 
You need to book Gabriel. He is knowledgeable, personable and a great guide who tailored our tour to our specific needs. 
Thank you Gabriel.
reviews/2/title: You need to book with Gabriel
reviews/3/text:
We had a great time with Gabriel and even spontaneously booked a second tour, one he specifically created according to our needs. Very friendly, accommodating and sociable tour guide, always on time and he went out of his way to show us a good time.
We recommend.
reviews/4/text: We booked GL Tours with Gabriel for 1 day. It was our last day in Portugal and Gabtiel shown us a few great spots on the way from Lagos to Faro from which we had a flight home. Gabriel drove us right to the most attractive points of cavoreiro and Abufeira and explained  where to go, what to see and where to eat. Super option for the day. No worries with the transportation, parking and looking around when you have little time. Gabriel shown us hidden gems we would probably not find ourselves. We recommend strongly.
reviews/5/text: I'm excited to tell you about this amazing tour guide, Gabriel Lima, who's knowledge and enthusiasm of the Algarve Region of Portugal is truly impressive. My wife and I were fortunate to have taken two tours during our stay and there was never a question that went unanswered with impressive detail. If you want to change the tour to your liking;  be it the time or direction, no problem. He will accommodate all requests. The vehicle he will use, depending on the number of passengers, will be clean and his driving is exemplary.  He can recommend restaurants and beaches for the remainder of your stay. As you can see with other GL Tour reviews, you will leave knowing you have a new friend.
reviews/6/text: We did 2 tours with Gabriel to Lagos & Carvoeiro and later in the week Faro. Knowledgeable and courteous, it was a pleasure to be in his company and see some of the fantastic places on the Algarve. Thank you Gabriel.
reviews/7/text:
Thank you so much for a fantastic afternoon. Gabrielle was so knowledgable, enthusiastic and kind! Would recommend 100%! 
The wine tour and tasting was also amazing! Fabulous afternoon out in the countryside.
reviews/8/text: If you require a reliable & courteous guide, adaptable to your needs then Gabriel comes highly recommended.  Enthusiastic & knowledgable he proved to be excellent company on our trips to Lagos & Carvoeiro & then to his Birthplace, the city of Faro. A really positive experience - a day full of smiles! One tip - book in advance if possible
reviews/9/text: We use GL Tours always when we travel to my Brothers apartment in Olhos D'Agua.Gabriel is Very Accommodating and Always Very Helpful With Our Requirements.I would Always Recommend Gabriel when Travelling To Portugal.
reviews/10/text: We (2 couples) had the pleasure of taking a small group tour with GL Tours (Gabriel) in June 2019.  We travelled from Albufiera to Silves, Lagos and Carnoviera with stops and walks along the way.  Gabriel is a knowledgeable, personable and experienced guide who showed us sights that we would never have found on our own.  He also allowed us time to explore on our own but keeping us on track so we could see as much as possible. This small group trip is a must do while in Portugal and GL Tours (Gabriel) is the way to go.  Highly recommended.  Thank you so much Gabriel!!
reviews/10/title: GL Tours is the way to go in Portugal!
reviews/11/text: The drivers were excellent: friendly, interesting and informative. The cars were very clean and comfortable, and refreshments were offered upon arrival! I would highly recommend this service and would definitely use again!!
reviews/12/text: We booked two private GL tours, one full day visiting magical Silves, Lagos and Carvoeiro and a half day tour of Faro, the atmospheric capital of the Algarve. Gabriel is extremely personable, entertaining and well informed. We gained so much knowledge and insight into the history of this stunning area, of which he is justly proud. It was a joy to spend time exploring, at the pace that suited us, with such an engaging guide. We felt we really benefited from having private tours. Can only recommend that you book Gabriel and see for yourself. If you are lucky you may also get to enjoy the delicious oranges he brought from his farm. Plus he sent us some photos afterwards - very happy memories. Will definitely contact Gabriel again when we revisit to book another adventure.
reviews/13/text:
My Mom and I were in Albufeira just for two days but wanted to get off the beaten path a bit and see some of the surrounding areas. Gabriel was super quick to respond and tailored our day to exactly what we wanted. His English was incredible and the information he provided was in depth and passionate. We loved asking Gabriel questions and felt like we were just out exploring with an old fried. 

If I return to Portugal I would hire Gabriel again in a second! Very highly recommended!!
reviews/14/text:
We booked the half-day Rural & Countryside tour with GL Tours, after checking the high rating and the reviews on tripadvisor site. And we were not disappointed. 
Gabriel picked us at our hotel. Then we had a wonderful time of exploring the Albufeira countryside. Drove through several small villages, stopped at the castle and the Roman Bridge at Paderne. Gabriel stopped at some farms as well and we could see cork trees, carob and olive trees, and a big orange farm. He also told us much about Portugal, its people and history. We reached to the pretty village of Alte where we had a little rest to enjoy that picturesque place. It was an amazing tour which made that day very special! Gabriel is not only a safe driver, he is very intelligent and knowledgeable, and is such a nice guy. Thank you, Gabriel!
reviews/15/text:
Booked a half day morning tour with Gabriel and it was definitely worth it. 
He is passionate about his work , his city and aims to give his customers the best possible service. He loves to share his extensive knowledge of his beautiful country. 
He picked us up at our hotel. We were given a bag of the most delicious and juicy oranges from his own farm , with 8 fresh egg tarts. These were, needless to say, extremely well received by the kids.  
We were driven to some of the most beautiful places in the area with stunning and breathtaking views. He is great at selfies ! 
He is also a safe and sensible driver , which to me is crucial especially with children around. 
I even managed to squeeze in an impromptu visit to a random
ice cream shop , where I had my first ever taste of rice pudding ice cream . 
Thank you Gabriel for making this trip so wonderful !!! 
I would highly recommend this motivated and enthusiastic individual.
reviews/16/text: I was in Portugal last autum with my Aunt and we spent a day touring with Gabriel. We explored the most intresting places and ate in a very special restaurant. Gabriel was one of the funniest guy I ever met but next to the humor and jokes we had a wonderful tour. He's knowledge and stories about the portugal culture is unconscious. We had a great time together and obviously it was one of the best days during our vacation. If you can take the chance and tour with Gabriel, it's amazing and unforgettable. :))
reviews/16/title: A day around Albufera and the South region
reviews/17/text: Booked this tour via Viator.  Gabriel hadn't had bookings via viator before and so we were his first.  We had informed GL Tours via viator that we had a small child with us.  As this was a walking tour, Gabriel bought his child's own push chair which he pushed giving me and my wife a bit more space to take in more from the tour.  What was brilliant was that Gabriel had brought us some oranges from his own farm and a bottle of water - all of which was unexpected but was a nice touch to the whole experience.  A brilliant tour made even better by Gabriel.  Would thoroughly recommend it.
reviews/18/text:
Five of us hired Gabriel for an afternoon  tour of the Algarve. The morning was torrential downpours but Gabriel assured me that he had been checking the radar and our trip would be rain free. He picked us up in Faro at noon and it was still raining.  As soon as we were on the highway the skies cleared.  Gabriel had brought us delicious oranges from his orchard, which we enjoyed!

We were awed by the amazing views in Ponta Da Piedad,  We also walked around the town of Lagos which included a stop at a local cafe for espresso, Pastel de Nada and Ginjinha in chocolate cups! Yum!  Our next stop was Sagres, where we saw the lighthouse on the southernmost point in Europe, Villa do Bispo.  Gabriel dropped us off in Faro with hugs and oranges.  We had a wonderful day and a fabulous tour guide!
reviews/19/text: Gabriel was good and talkative. Very funny and a good friend. He shows Algarve to people very lovingly. We never felt rushed or bored along the way and even had the perfect amount of time for a nice lunch in Lagos.
tags/urgency_tag/tag_text: Tours from GL Tours tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

address: Museu de Portimao, Portimao 8500-607 Portugal
description: All our boats comply with safety standards and have all the safety equipment required by Portuguese legislation. We are inspected annually and your trip includes full insurance. Safety always comes first.
name: MyCrew Algarve Tours
photo/caption: This one you know, right? Benail Cave
ranking: #46 of 485 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Algarve
ranking_subcategory: #46 of 485 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Algarve
reviews/0/text: We have booked a private Cave Tour. The Crew was wonderful, we felt safe all the Time and we got a lot Information about the coastline and the caves we have visited. And the Trip back was really Fun because we made it, like a speedboat.
reviews/0/title: Wonderful Cave Tour along the Coastline
reviews/1/text: Thank you so much to Mycrew for an amazing 2 hours! It was our last day in Portugal and decided to go on a boat trip to the caves. They guys spoke every language and were so informative on the trip. It really was a memorable trip and when we had finished they gave us all a photo of our group. Very special thank you
reviews/2/text: We loved the visit and the Crew and we highly recommend the experience. Both our teen daughters also loved the speed of the boat.
reviews/2/title: Visit to the caves in Algarve by sea
reviews/3/text: We were lucky enough to have the boat to ourselves and having chosen the last trip of the day the weather was just perfect, not too hot. Miguel and his colleague were lovely friendly and informative. They made sure we had a brilliant time and I was impressed with Miguels ability to navigate through the narrow caves. The scenery is just stunning. I highly recommend this experience with My crew.
reviews/4/text: We were looking forward to the tour, stood at the meeting point and no one showed. Another captain called ours and only then we got a call to announce it had been canceled. Apparently for sea conditions although all other companies were leaving and a very sleepy voice... Not nice for our group. Luckily we were able to catch another boat with another company.
reviews/5/text: Fabulous 2 hour trip. We were lucky that there were only two of us on the 9am trip .Great local knowledge and friendly guide . Well worth it .
reviews/6/text:
We were 4 adults and 2 3-year old kids; we've booked the day before the trip through experitour.com where immediately I was contacted through whatsapp with the sea level situation and when is the most time to go with kids and this part was really helpful. Gathering location was also send to us through google Maps.

Next Day, we went to the location and we took a private boat. Trip was almost 2-2.5 hours, Captain was really helpful and understandable that we have kids; so he knew when to go fast and when not. We went to many caves including the Benagil caves.

He asked if we want to swim in the sea where he then chose a perfect location to swim.

He also kept describing places and getting near to many beaches and inside many caves illustrating the history.

It was really nice experience and highly recommended company to go with.
reviews/6/title: Excellent trip! A must to do
reviews/7/text: Adoramos a viagem, e os nossos filhos de 5 e 2 anos também. Fizeram uma óptima explicação do percurso e o staff é super simpático e com uma óptima sensibilidade para cativar os nossos filhos. A repetir!
reviews/8/text:
Equipa 5*, uma experiência magnífica!
Com a cereja no topo do bolo, termos visto golfinho.
A recomendar sem duvida!
reviews/9/text: Adorei , desde a simpatia ao passeio e ainda tivemos direito a uma oferta muito agradável , muito obrigada
reviews/10/text: Filippa muy agradable con sus explicaciones y Marcelo todo un capitán que nos metió en infinidad de cuevas. Te envían whats con info y lugar de salida en Portimâo. Hablaron principalmente en portugués pero si no entendíamos nos informaba en castellano. Precio calidad muy competitivo. La lancha muy apta para introducirse en todas las cuevas. Máximo éramos 14 personas. Hubo bañito al final del tour. Muy recomendable y los niños disfrutaron mucho.
reviews/11/text:
Que experiência incrível! Desde a marcação da viagem com o Bruno Silva até à Filipa e ao Marcelo, que nos guiaram nesta aventura, só temos coisas boas a dizer e a agradecer. Muito prestáveis e simpáticos desde o primeiro minuto.
A viagem - de cerca de duas horas - é simplesmente deslumbrante, com paisagens de cortar a respiração.
Para terminar em beleza, a Filipa tinha uma surpresa para nós: uma fotografia nossa, para eternizarmos a experiência. 
Sem dúvida que recomendo e que iremos repetir!
reviews/12/text: Todas as medidas de segurança foram cumpridas. Equipa profissional e divertida. Experiência a repetir, sem dúvida!
reviews/13/text:
A ultima hora lo reservamos por internet. En todo momento nos contactaron para ayudarnos en la localizacion
Explican todo a la perfeccion y cada detalle
El baño y la foto una experiencia y detalle unico! Repitiriamos sin dudarlo
reviews/14/text:
Adorei, super recomendo 
Pessoal animado, acolhedor, e super atencioso!! Valeu a pena cada cêntimo
reviews/15/text: Uma viagem de uma hora e meia (mais ou menos ) muito bem organizada e preenchida, que nos permite ver o que de melhor o Algarve tem! Recomendo imenso
reviews/15/title: Das melhores viagens de barco que já fiz ! Senão a melhor
reviews/16/text:
Acolhimento excelente. Tripulação extraordinária.  
Aconselho vivamente a realizarem passeios com esta equipa maravilha. Muito obrigada
reviews/17/text: Superbe balade, Bruno le Capitaine est super. Le bateau passe partout. Explications et anecdotes. Temps pour faire des photos super souvenir. Petite astuce vous pouvez réserver à l'office de tourisme de Portimao. Merci Bruno et votre Papa
reviews/18/text:
Adoramos o passeio . Barco novo é excelente. Não é dos grandes e por isso énima vantagem para o passeio, pois conseguiu acesso em todas as grutas.
O piloto tem muita habilidade e conduziu o passeio de forma exemplar! Existem varias opções para o passeio, mas recomendo muito está! Show!
reviews/18/title: Ótima opção para o passeio de Benagil
reviews/19/text: Nous avons bien fait de choisir cette balade avec cet organisme nous avons pris un petit bateau de 8 personnes notre skipper s'appelait Rodrigo une perle!! pendant 2h30 il nous a baladé dans les grottes avec des couleurs!!!!! dans ce bord de mer qu'il faut absolument découvrir ainsi. Si il  nous reste à vie un souvenir de l'Algarve c'est ce moment 30 euros par personnes c'est vraiment correct pour la qualité du service Bravo on conseille ++++
subcategory_ranking: #46 of 485 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Algarve

address: Marina de Albufeira, Albufeira Portugal
name: Oceaneye
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Benagil Caves Visit with Dolphins Watching from Albufeira
ranking: #47 of 485 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Algarve
ranking_subcategory: #47 of 485 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Algarve
reviews/0/text: We had a brilliant trip with Jorges, the guide. He was really knowledgeable and very friendly. We even saw dolphins!
reviews/1/text: We had an incredible time with Pedro and George. They were wonderful tour guides. We were two families with young children, and astoundingly, we were able to see a TON of dolphins - we rode alongside a pod for quite a while. It was incredible seeing them jump and swim in the water. I especially enjoyed the wonderful music that they played - really captured the emotions of the amazing moment. The caves and cliffs we saw were remarkable, but the highlight was truly the dolphins. The children were amazed. My little one wants to be a Marine Biologist and this experience was pretty solidifying for her career choice!
reviews/2/text: The tour guides were very nice, they tried to make our experience as great as possible. We were able to see large groups of dolphins and the visit to the caves was just amazing. The boat was perfect and very comfortable.
reviews/3/text: I was visiting the Algarve and went on a sea tour with oceaneye.  Dolphins appears and they were beautiful and big!! The crew was so funny and I loved the music that they put in all special situations. It was just beautiful! No words needed, just recommend to go.
reviews/3/title: One of the best tours ever
reviews/4/text: Amazing experience.. Guides did their best to find the dolphins.. And we actually could spot dolphins twice .. Caves visit were also nice! Great value for money!
reviews/5/text:
Me, my boyfriend and my little sister booked a trip with them and it was amazing, they mentioned to us before we leave ''see the dolphins is not a guarantee'' although they said straight a way they spotted the dolphins and instead of visiting the caves first as it was programed, we rushed into where they were last spotted, so we could reach the dolphins before the swim away.

It was really amazing a smooth run, it was my first experience ever like this. I would recommend 100%
reviews/6/text:
Awesome experience visiting limestone caves along the Algarve coast, history and facts very informative and to top it all the viewing and following of bottle nosed dolphins way out at sea. Be ready for the return, it's a rollercoaster on arrival. Truly enjoyable
A Oliveira
reviews/7/text: They really went out of their way to try and find dolphins. Funny and entertaining. Beautiful views.
reviews/8/text: Brilliant experience, got a tour of the caves and seen the dolphins. Crew were very friendly and nice. Tour was informative and fun and we were assured that the dolphins were not guaranteed but our guide took an extra half an hour out on the water and we got to see them. Had a great time and would recommend to anyone.
reviews/9/text: I loved the last part where we went fast and crazy with the Mambo nr 5 song! I liked the guide who was talking about every cave we saw and he was a very nice company on the boat during the whole trip.
reviews/10/text: It was a really nice experience. We did a particular rental of the boat with our two 16 year old teens. The team was friendly and explained a lot of things. We found around 12 Dolphins group and quietly staid with them. Later on we went into the impressive caves. I totally recommend this tour!
reviews/10/title: Great tour between dolphins and caves
reviews/11/text:
The staff was very Nice! They did everything for us to feel good. They explain a lot of dolphins and Algarve coast.
We enjoy so much the boat trip. 
I recomend.
reviews/12/text: Everything about this trip exceeded expectations. Our guide was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, the boat was driven expertly and the DJing was fab too! We saw amazing dolphins and views of the caves.
reviews/13/text:
Thanks to João and his father we had an marvellous experience visiting the caves with the boat ! 
Totally recommend! 
Thank you one more time for collecting my cap from the ocean,really appreciated!
reviews/14/text:
My wife and i really enjoyed this wonderful trip. It was a great experience to see the wild dolphins. We left the harbor at 12:00 and after 30-40 min, we met a group of these lovely animals. Unforgettable! The tour guide gave a great commentary about the dolphins and the  beautiful coastline.
Also the size of the boat is just perfect for this tour (Max.: 15-20 people).
Highly recommended!
reviews/15/text: We really enjoyed this wonderful trip. Diago gave a great commentary about the beautiful coastline and it was wonderful to see the dolphins too. Pedro was a very good captain and we loved the music choices too. Would thoroughly recommend it to others.
reviews/16/text: The crew was very kind. They gave us a lot of information about the caves. We saw a lot of dolphins.
reviews/17/text: Unforgettable experience! If you want to see the most iconic caves Albufeira has to offer I definitely recommend you this activity! We saw the dolphins and the guide was extremely nice he was also polyglot! He made us comfortable and made us feel safe throughout the whole trip! This is the boat experience you definitely want!
reviews/18/text: We decided to book this tour because the price was lower than other agencies and offered a tour searching for dolphins and caves in a small boat (max 18 person). The tour was amazing: we saw dolphins and the caves are worth it. Recommended experience if you go to Algarve. The tour guide was kind and nice!
reviews/19/text:
We had a great time with Pedro and Diego ! They made sure everyone had. A great time ! The music was awesome ! Nice people ! Great expérience ! They are available! Over all lots of fun! I  a 1000 time  recommend Oceaneye! 
Thank you again Diego and Pedro !
subcategory_ranking: #47 of 485 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Algarve

address: Rua nova da Cruz,9 Hotel Real Marina, Olhao 8700-304 Portugal
description: In this tour Carla's Food & wine experience, we. go a special place, is private, to savor the wine (3 red wine, 1 rosé wine, 1 white and 1 green wine) and at the same time some traditional tapas (chorizo, cheese, smoked ham mussels , almonds, figs, ... and more stuff, very traditional). And in the end a few suprises. I have a selection of porto wine Always a good climate and very peaceful
name: Love Tuk Olhao
reviews/0/text: We went on this tuk tuk tour shortly after our arrival in Olhao. This was a great way to get to know the place, see the sights, learn some of the history and main economy of the area. We also received some useful information for our stay and where to eat. Great to be shown around by someone who is local and knows their town well and is very enthusiastic about it.
reviews/0/title: A fun and informative way to get to know Olhao
reviews/1/text: If you want to experience real Algarviana heritage, the Tuk Tuk tour is a must. Sophia took us on a local tour of Olhão (warning: emphasis on local), we got a see various sights including the production of salt. Amazing scenery! After the tour we were taken to a wine tavern in Olhão Marina Strip where we did our Wine/Tapas tasting experience. Both Goncalo and Sophia were very knowledgeable and welcoming. A must do experience and worth coming to even if not in a local hotel. We were in a hotel in Albufeira...
reviews/1/title: Love Tuk City Tour and Wine/Tapas Tasting Experience
reviews/2/text: Highly recommend a Love Tuk wine tasting and tapas tour. The tour around Olhao was great with the tour guides brilliant and informative. The tapas and wine tasting was a real treat. Carla was a fantastic host and a great time was had by all! Great value for money. You do come out of there needing a rest and a lie down after all that wine and food!
reviews/3/text: We had a blast with the best tour guides in the area Roberto and Sophia (hope the names are correct). We done a tour of the city and finished with a beautiful wine tasting and a feast of local produce. The following day we done the tour of the local towns and villages in the surrounding hills. The guides were so informative about everything we seen. The price was so good for everything we got to see and taste. Also the put us in the right direction to hire a boat to tour the islands which was amazing!!!
reviews/4/text: What a great afternoon.  We were collected by tuk tuk from our accommodation and taken on a 45 minute tour of Olhao.  Roberto proved to be a very entertaining and knowledgeable guide with a great sense of humour.  We were then dropped off at Carla's place for wine tasting and tapas.  The table was laden with the most delicious tapas and we were treated to some brilliant wines and ports - be warned, these aren't sample sizes but full glasses!  Carla was such an amazing host and so enthusiastic about everything.  All too soon it was time for Roberto to take us back.  If you are interested in good food and wine we would highly recommend this trip.
reviews/5/text:
If you do nothing else in Olhao you must take this tour.
Carla is a warm and welcoming host and so passionate and enthusiastic about authentic Portuguese food and wine. Her knowledge of both is extensive and she is eager to explain how each of the dishes are cooked and the origins and histories of the wines, all in a friendly informative way.
The food was delicious and abundant. All of the various wines, white, rose and red were fantastic and the ports were to die for.
Definitely top of the list for a return visit next time we are in Olhao.
reviews/6/text:
We stayed in Olhao for 6 days and our Love Tuk tour was the best part of our trip! My sister, her boyfriend and I were picked up by Roberto at our apartment and were given a tour of the beautiful city of Olhao. We ran into Roberto's wife and grandfather during the tour, a great surprise! We also visited the beautiful salt pans. We learned so much about the city and its history. Roberto was a wonderful tour guide and it was an added bonus to meet some family members!

Roberto then brought us to the wine and food tasting. Carla showed us the beautiful space and introduced herself. We tried so many Portuguese wines and authentic dishes (definitely do not eat before you attend :)) The food was amazing and Carla explained how she made each dish. We learned so much about Portugueses wines - this is experience is informative AND delicious. It was also so much fun to sit around the table with other travelers and meet new people. This tour is great for groups, solo travelers, and everyone in between! 

Both Roberto and Carla made our trip to Olhao truly unforgettable. I would HIGHLY recommend the city+food & wine tour. This was the best part of our trip and we would do it again in a heartbeat.
reviews/6/title: City tour and wine tasting extravaganza!
reviews/7/text:
This is our fifth visit to Olhao and every year we have booked a trip with Love Tuk and have never been disappointed. Roberto is a fantastic guy and cannot do enough for you. Very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the region.
Love Tuk now also have a boating company and we spent a very enjoyable afternoon touring the islands with Thiago as our pilot. Snorkelling in crystal clear waters on picturesque beaches.
I would definitely recommend a trip with Love Tuk.
reviews/8/text: By far one of the best experiences on the Algarve. I could not recommend this experience highly enough! This has been my second visit with Carla and it did not disappoint. The food and wine was amazing as well as the knowledge behind it all. I will be back again soon!
reviews/9/text:
This was advertised as a wine tasting so we expected to be driven up into the hills to some vineyards for a wine tasting session and some food. In actual fact the tour is so much more than that which added to the experience. 

We met at the Real Marina hotel where there is parking available. Roberto was the guide for us and he was excellent, very knowledgable and enthusiastic about the tour and his city and it’s area. He went into depth on the history, took us to the salt flats telling us all about them and also gave us the low down on the tiles on the building and the door knockers which all have different meanings. 

He also showed us the library, prison and the football stadium and some back streets that you would never normally stumble upon. It was an excellent city tour which we absolutely loved. 

We then went to Carla’s traditional Portuguese house for some wine & port tasting as well as the food; WOW! doesn’t quite cover it! 

There was a whole table loaded with fresh, home cooked food which all looked and tasted fantastic. Carla went into detail about the food and how she prepared it all. She was keen to let us know that with advanced notice she can cater for vegetarians and vegans too creating some fantastic dishes. 

We then went onto the actual wine and port tastings which were advertised as about 3 wines and 1 port, in actual fact we tasted more wines than I can remember and a lot more than just 1 port. The measures we got were about half a glass as well not just your usual ‘tasting’ absolutely excellent and really good value for money so far! All the wines and port was available to buy and take away with you but there was no hard sell, it was just a case of ‘this is this one and a bottle is.....’ 

There was also loads of information from Carla about how the grapes are grown and how it’s all produced, there was also a lovely white port to try. 

Based on this experience if you’re based in the area and don’t do this tour I’d say your mad. As I said it’s advertised as a wine tasting but it’s so much more than that! 

A fantastic experience that I would love to do again. Totally recommend.
reviews/9/title: City tour with some wine tasting and food.
reviews/10/text:
We booked the tour to do it in one go but due to demamd we had to do the city tour 1st with our guide Roberto. 
This was our 1st trip using a TukTuk and it is to say the least an experience which we would both recommend and our guide Roberto made us both very welcome as he showed us around his home town city of Olhoa 
 We would both say if you come to Olhoa take a Tuktuk you will love it.
reviews/11/text:
This experiance is well worth it. The Tapas was enough to put you in a food coma. All of the food was amazing. Our host Carla described all of the food and wine in detail. You couldn't ask for a better host. 
The wine was from all over Portugal. The tuk tuk tour of the city was also a treat to see. The trip takes you to places of Olhao you would not walk to. It was nice to see how the locals live and the industry around the area. Our driver "G" (I dont want to butcher his name) was very friendly. He explained the area vividly with great enthusiasm.  This is an experiance I would not pass up. Great job to the team.
reviews/12/text:
Could not of asked for a better experience!

The wine and tapas was of the highest quality and Carla, our host, was passionate and knowledgeable about everything on the table, and boy, was there lots on the table! Copious amounts of everything left everyone very merry and grinning from ear to ear. 

At €60 for 2 people it was value personified (we paid an extra €20 for pick up/drop off, which was a 15 minute drive).

Highly recommend... Only if you like amazing wine and tapas!!! 

Jack and Anna
reviews/13/text: Well we thought 85€ for a couple was probably a little steep but read the reviews and thought why not? So glad we did. Home cooked tapas and loads of it. 13 wines and port's tasted. Great host in Carla. Roberto the driver of out Tuk took us all round the city. It took 3.5 hours in all and certainly value for money. Would certainly do again if we come back. Only 8 people at a time so quite an intimate wine tasting where you could get to know people. Highlight of the holiday. Thanks somuch for a great experience.
reviews/14/text:
We booked an afternoon tour of the city of Olhão and then on to a wine tasting tour with tapas food 
Other than feeling a bit nervous when we traveled along the salt mines in the tuk tuk ( which was actually good fun) this is a must do for any holiday break in Olhão 
The two guys that drove us on the city tour were friendly and informative in equal measure 
We where them taken to meet Carla for a lovely afternoons exploration of Portuguese wines and food 
Carla has a very warm personality and explained both the food and wine very well ( I’m going to try some of her suggestions ) all the wines where delicious and I tasted flavours that I haven’t tried before 
All in all a great afternoon I would recommend to all
reviews/14/title: Lovely way to spend an afternoon
reviews/15/text: This is a must when visiting Olhão. A 45 minute ride around the town and salt farm followed by the best tapas and wine tasting you are ever likely to experience anywhere in the world. Roberto was a fantastic tour guide with a local knowledge of everything about town. Carla was also an amazing, warm and generous host for the wine tasting. We had a wide selection of whites and reds from across Portugal followed by an array of Ports, Moscatel and  liqueurs. Carla’s knowledge was imparted with enthusiasm and care. We will certainly be back.
reviews/16/text:
We were collected bang on time by two lovely young men who were affable, knowledgable, and friendly.  They spent 45 minutes giving us a tour of the City, including the salt flats, historical buildings, and points of interest around the City. 
After the lovely tour, we were taken to Carla’s magical wine cellar where we were greeted by a lavish banquet of Portuguese tapas, all of which were made and presented with love and panache.  Each and every dish was superb, in terms of taste, quantity and in presentation.  All the ingredients were the finest, and all locally sourced from local markets or farmers.  Truly delicious. 
We were presented with an abundance of wonderful Portuguese wines - each one lovingly chosen to present their characteristics, and the massive differences between wines of the same type - eg Vinho Verde.
The explanations were clear, informative, and precise.  They wines were clearly known, and were eloquently described.  Carla’s manner was so friendly and knowledgable, it was a treat to listen!
After many different wines, Ports and Grappas, the afternoon, sadly came to an end.  There was no push to buy wines, but they were there if wanted. 
I have been on dozens of wine tours in my time - not least because I was a tutor in an hotel school - but this was certainly the friendliest and most enjoyable one that I’ve ever been on; my three friends concur.
Thank you so much to Carla, Roberto, and the most handsome driver in Portugal whose name I cannot spell!!
We spent the most perfect afternoon here: this has the highest recommendation we can give!
I absolutely guarantee that we’re coming back for another class very soon.
reviews/17/text: One of the best things I've ever done on holiday.  The tapas was amazing with so much choice as was the wine tasting. We will definitely do it again next time we are In Olhao.
reviews/18/text: This was the best thing we did during our stay in Olhão it was a fabulous combined trip of the city tour and the wine and food tasting. Roberto was tremendous he took us around the salt flats explained the history of the city then onto the food and wine tasting - WOW - Carla was waiting with a table heaving with local tapas delicacies. The wine was gorgeous a green,a white, a rose then 3 of Portugal’s reds and a selection of port to boot - what’s not to love - their name suits them LOVE TUK
reviews/19/text: We had an incredible tour seeing the salt flats, rio Formosa, old town and enjoyed a super relaxed afternoon drinking 6 wines 5 ports etc etc with some amazing delicacies. Can’t wait to come back when the guesthouse is open.
tags/urgency_tag/tag_text: Tours from Love Tuk Olhao tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

address: Rua Cabo Verde 54 R/C, Portimao 8200-386 Portugal
description: Portitours is specialized in Adventure and Active Tourism in Portugal, specifically in the Algarve region, that due to its exceptional geoclimatic situation, offers the ideal conditions to the practice of these experiences. We organize outdoor events like Jeep Safaris, hiking, cruises, cultural visits, wine tasting and incentive programmes, Team-Building and Adventure Challenges for conference and leisure groups. Portitours’ Team-Building events help to create new work relation dynamics, promote team work and help developing problem solving habilities, while promoting a healthy competition element. In the experiences offered to individual customers, we include the practice of all activities in contact with nature, adding yet the cultural character, which allows those who visit us to get closer, not only with the natural environment, but also with the uses and customs of our region. Our experiences are suitable for nature lovers of all ages, with a great desire to discover new places.
name: Portitours
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Jeep Safari #1 in Algarve
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Magical Benagil Cave Cruise
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Dolphin Discovery
reviews/0/text: Fantastic trip great to get off the beaten track and see beautiful villages and Portuguese countryside. George our guide was fabulous. Amazing value for money
reviews/0/title: Great trip, excellent value for money
reviews/1/text: What an awesome ride with the two best guides/driver (Diego was the guide).  Saw magnificent caves and even went into some of them.  Beautiful ride from Portimao to Benagil. Boat was great and felt safe and secure.
reviews/2/text: Ricardo was a great captain and me and my partner had such a beautiful tour! We took the 2hr trip around the caves, cliffs and beaches. We enjoyed hearing about the history around portimão and surrounding areas. The coastline is absolutely stunning! I felt safe on the boat even when the sea became quite choppy! The seating on the boat is set up in 2 rows but I still had ample space. I would highly recommend portitours!
reviews/3/text: The tour was fantastic! Our guides were very kind, informative, and humorous. They made the experience a ton of fun for both us and our 6yo son. The scenery and coastline was spectacular and definitely worth the trip. The ride was a little chilly this time of year (Feb), but dressing with a couple layers and a wind jacket did the trick. The meeting point seems a bit random when you arrive as it’s basically an isolated parking lot with no signage. But the pin that drops on a map from their confirmation email is correct. Highly recommend Portitours!
reviews/4/text: Great tour. The guide was wonderful. Very informative and entertaining. Would repeat this your. The wine portion ‘Cabrita’ of the tour was interesting and the wine very good.  I would love to purchase more of the red wine to place in my cellar. The caves and beaches beautiful.
reviews/5/text: Excellent day spent on the water looking for dolphins. Which we found then in and out of the caves along the coast. Definitely recommended.
reviews/6/text:
There were two stand out trips with portitours that my partner and myself loved, this was the 4x4 safari and the sunset & moonlight tour. Following leaving a separate review on the dolphin & caves tour I feel like I should leave one on these two tours.

We ended up having the same driver for both of these trips, George, and he was brilliant. Shared loads of amazing facts about Portugal, the Algarve and especially.. cork! 

The 4x4 trip was brilliant, was exactly as it said on the tin. The views from Monchique mountain were amazing and the lunch on the trip was tasty. The only downside to this trip was that we were in the back for the majority of it so the window view wasn’t fantastic and you do get tossed around a bit but since we were the last ones to get picked up, we didn’t have much of a choice but we loved it all the same. The firewater was interesting but the honey was a treat, we bought a jar of it home. 

The sunset & moonlight tour was different, even though we ended up on Monchique again, the whole atmosphere was different. It was a beautiful sunset that evening and made it even more special with the amazing photos George took of myself and my partner.. and made a great camera man when my partner surprised me by proposing. Again another delicious meal once we were descending mountain. 

Would highly recommend these two trips to anyone visiting the Algarve, and we will definitely be back in years to come!
reviews/7/text:
Awesome, energetic. A super fun experience. Marcelo & GPS were outstanding and very knowledgable tour guides and made the experience a memorable one!!!

A 5/5* experience and a gorgeous day to top it off
reviews/8/text: The whole day was great but the knowledge of our driver made it that more interesting. Also the off road driving element mean that you were not just driving around on public roads.
reviews/9/text:
Amazing ! We love the expedition ! Wonderful !
Our children are happy to discover that and we are very satisfated !
reviews/10/text: My family and I from Belfast went on the full day jeep safari, I have to say this was the best day of our holiday, was great to get of the beaten track and explore the real Algarve, our driver was very knowledgeable, a great entertainer, and very very good driver, if you are thinking about going on this trip just book it you won't be disappointed..
reviews/11/text: They attended us very well. So much fun, sun and food. Nice price for the sites we visited. So much fun
reviews/12/text: Took the 4 X 4 tour in a Land Rover on June 12, 2022.  Booked the excursion while on a cruise ship.  Walter was our driver / guide and was fantastic.  Explained in detail the area, and showed samples of local plants and cork trees.  Vehicles are open air and while the temperature was warm, there was a nice breeze in the vehicle and the views were amazing.  Visited a distillery with the tour and tasted the product, as well as home grown honey.  Highly recommend this tour.  If you book this, bring Walter a Harley Davidson tee shirt.  He loves them.
reviews/13/text:
We did the sunset moon rise tour with Ricardo, 
Magical,  awesome,  fantastic, 
Our guide took us to a couple of small villages in the mountains before our meal, which he spoke to the chef as my partner has food allergies,  and made sure she was able to eat and experience the evening,  the sun set was amazing, Ricardo was a joy to be with, and gave us a local experience with loads of Portuguese info and culture history,  and can highly recommend this tour as Ricardo really did go the extra mile,,,
Thankyou,
Memories last forever 
Jay & Tan
reviews/14/text: We all enjoyed the experience, the guys were very informative and comical. Would definitely recommend and go again.
reviews/15/text: Was a wonderful day the crew was very attentive and happy and made our day very enjoyable the food was good I gave to her was excellent
reviews/15/title: Great tour with good food and great views of the caves and a wonderful staff
reviews/16/text:
I've had the pleasure of experiencing numerous excursions with Portitours and loved every single one! José & the team have perfected the art of good times!
Two of my favourite:
*Jeep Safari* perfect for all ages, such a fun day with extremely friendly, knowledgeable and humorous drivers! Perfect for experiencing the Portuguese culture, sight seeing, photo opportunities and making memories to last forever! 
*Ophelia Catamaran Caves Tour & Beach BBQ* the boat is beautiful, very spacious, clean and modern. On board the staff are very attentive and pay special attention to everybody's safety and wellbeing. The crew are professional, friendly and fun! The views from inside the caves are breathtaking!! The Algarve coastline is stunning! Food on the secluded beach is a fresh BBQ which is cooked to perfection. 
I can't wait to return, first thing I'll be doing is booking my place on trips with the first class Portitours team. See you again soon! Thank you for the memories!!  PAMELA X X X
reviews/16/title: The best excursions in the Algarve!! #1
reviews/17/text: We did the boat tour and Dolphin watching. We were hosted by our “Captain” Ricardo, whose English was very good, his knowledge brilliant and kept the audience/ visitors entertained. We saw some Dolphins (like all things not always guaranteed) and the caves and coastline tour was excellent. Well worth a trip.
reviews/18/text: We've booked the activity: Algarve by land and sea. This was a walking tour of about 6 kilometers followed by a boat trip along the caves from Portimão. The guides spoke several languages and could tell us a lot about the area and did this in a nice way. The walk took us along beautiful cliffs. The paths were not all easy to walk, but it was doable for us. Despite the fact that, according to TUI, only a snack was included, we were offered delicious sandwiches for lunch. After lunch we took a boat ride along the cliffs. The captain of the boat did his best to make it a fun trip. We had a very nice day!
reviews/19/text: It was a great Tour with a very frindly driver as guide. We were only four members and so it was like a private Tour. The dinner was very tastefull and authentic. We saw a great sundown on the Mountain with verry good pictures.
tags/urgency_tag/tag_text: Tours from Portitours tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

address: Jardim Patrao Joaquim Lopes Avenida 5 de Outubro Cais, Olhao 8700-307 Portugal
address_obj/street1: Jardim Patrao Joaquim Lopes Avenida 5 de Outubro
animal_welfare_tag/msg_body: Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.
description: Discover the wonders of nature on the Ria Formosa and be amazed and dazzled by this fragile and complex ecosystem. Ecotourism in Ria Formosa, Algarve Portugal.
name: Sabino Boat Tours
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: 4-Hour Private Boat Tour in Ria Formosa
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: 3-Hour Boat Tour in Ria Formosa on Olhão Algarve
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Private Sightseeing Boat Tour in Ria Formosa at Olhão
ranking: #48 of 485 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Algarve
ranking_subcategory: #48 of 485 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Algarve
reviews/0/text: We did the 5 hour Parque da Ria Foromosa tour.  They say three island tour (really 3 landing points but you do see three islands).  The first stop at the Faro Lighthouse, village and beach (West end of the Island) where you can also see part of the Ilha de Beretta (and the farthest Southern point in Portugal. The it is off to the 2 hour Lunch stop at village of Cultara (very good food but expect service to be slow, methodical, with each dish prepared in serial order and usually worth the wait) a true Portuguese fishing village.  Here you can also walk to the beach on the Atlantic side of the Island (definitely worth the effort); then back to the boat and to the far East end where you enter the sea horse preserve and see the third island Ilha Armona.  Our captain was "young Joao" who did a masterful job of answering every question and explaining what makes this National Park special and its biological diversity, how the aqua-culture farming and the real fishing works.  He also can (and did) talk about all the species of fish and fowl that are in the park.  One of the things that is most interesting is how much the Portuguese are doing to try and preserve their natural habitats and to work at fixing the human cause ecologic damage that has occurred.  See it now before it is all under water.
reviews/0/title: A great tour and educational experience
reviews/1/text: We have been visiting Portugal regularly for years but had never been to Olhao.., with the new marina we were eager to try out and booked a day trip for the two of us…  wow wow wow  Our skipper Joao was so experienced and knowledgeable - his boat trip was the absolute highlight of our vacation highly recommend xx
reviews/2/text: I took the 5 hour boat tour from Olhao and it was great. We had a small group of 5 (6 with the guide) he was very knowledgeable of the area. The weather was great. We stopped to look for seahorses, we had an opportunity to swim in tone of the deserted areas near the inlet. We went to lunch on Armona Island and the food was very good. What a great day for a spectacular price.
reviews/3/text:
What a nice trip. We didn’t see the time flying by.

The skippers (Joao and Joao) are so professional. They told us everything we needed to know during the trip. After a little bit of patience, we finally (thanks to the cooperation with other boat trip companies) found a big group of dolphins. They were much more closer and interactive than expected.

It was nice to see how the skippers respect the environment and the animals. As they said, that’s the proper way to see dolphins. 

(We even saw a shark!)

Muito obrigado guys!
reviews/4/text:
It was a wonderful tour. We were lucky and got into a big school of dolphins. They swam all around our boat, were almost within reach, jumped in synchronized formations and accompanied us for a long while. It is truly an unforgettable experience to be so close in communication with these creatures

The two skippers are extremely experienced and friendly, knowledgeable and willing to provide information, moreover, they make the greatest effort to find the place where dolphins can be seen.

Outstanding!
reviews/5/text:
Amazing 1hr 30 trip with a stop for swimming! Very friendly & knowledgeable skipper!

Highly recommended
reviews/6/text:
Had the pleasure of enjoying a 6h boat trip with João who explained everything nicely.

Lovely views and an excellent service! Recommend it a lot to both tourists and locals.
reviews/7/text: We went on the 5 hour boat trip with lunch.  Starting at 1100.  The tour was fantastic the best boat tour we’ve ever been on. Great value for money, it included lunch which was superb. We will be back. Daniel the driver was superb very informative and a superb host for the day. Congrats you have a winning formula.
reviews/8/text:
We did the dolphin watching as a big family  group. The guide was extremely knowledgable having worked as a fisherman previously. Safety was very good.
 We were also very lucky to see the dolphins. All in all a great experience and we would recommend to anyone.
reviews/9/text:
Great host ... a lot of explanation. 
Would book again anytime.
Took largely the time to let us visit, walk around, discover. 
Thanks a lot!
reviews/10/text: We will remember this tour in any case. It was just brilliant and very informative. Our tour guide was the owner of the company and he literally explained everything so well and took the time to show us every worth spot during this tour. We can highly recommend the tour. The lunch was great too. 5 Stars!!! Thanks
reviews/10/title: 5 hours boat tour (in the Ende it was 6 hours) with lunch
reviews/11/text: We really enjoyed our 5 hours tour with the lunch. The islands we visited were beautiful and our Skipper gave us a lot of infos about the Ria Farmosa, totally recommend this tour!
reviews/12/text: 6 of us went on the 5 hour tour including lunch with our guide Jaime. We paid €100 extra to ensure the boat was exclusively ours. It was both informative and fun with stops for 2 swims, lunch and the fishing village bars. The lunch included plenty of wine and we had a fish or meat option, the sardines and bream were delicious. It was a great day that we would do again.
reviews/13/text:
We had the pleasure of going on a 3 hour boat trip with the company. Carla was really helpful on emails and gave me advice on where to park.
The trip was informative and our guide Daniel made the trip-he was incredible and just so authentic as a person.
Best boat trip we have ever been on I can not recommend enough! Well done guys great time!!
reviews/14/text:
5 hour trip around the Ria Formosa. Lunch included in a restaurant in Farol, local fish was delicious.
Stunning scenery and eco system, great knowledge from the skipper. A fascinating insight into a beautiful area.
Good value for money.
I highly recommend Sabino Tours
Leave plenty of time to park.
reviews/15/text: A total joy ride! Jaime, our skipper, was mega friendly, uber attentive and always had a witty remark to brighten his amazing narration about the area, its nature and its history. The landscape is breath taking and the water warm and clear. I will surely take this ride again with him!
reviews/15/title: Amazing 3-hour boat ride with an awesome skipper
reviews/16/text: Educational, fantastic, relaxing, safe and clean 5h Boat Trip with sympathic Captain Joao at the boat, at the restaurant, on the island, in and on the water. We consciously chose SABINO BOAT TOURS because we had an extraordinary experience with the Dolphin Tour last year.  Again the Team did not disappoint us. Maria,  cordially and helpful at the customer service point and Joao, a great Captain who shares his experience, knowledge and Love to the beautiful Ria Farmosa with everyone. Thank you for sharing, being such a great Team and giving us the possibility to have such an incredible daytrip. Gema & Carlos from Germany
reviews/16/title: Educational, fantastic, relaxing, safe and clean 5h Boat Trip with sympathic Captain Joao.
reviews/17/text:
On the 4th of August we had a fantastic boat tour. We enjoyed the nature and the interesting stories and explanations Jao told us. 
And of course also the beautiful Dolphins. 
We recommend Sabino Boat tours! Very friendly and professional people.
Next time in Portugal we choose you again.
reviews/18/text:
Jaime was such a great host! He is incredibly knowledgeable about the area and he can answer pretty much every question! I don't think our trip would be the same without him. He was kind, attentive, funny and you could feel his love and passion for this region.
Overall, our day tour took longer than 5hours, we have learned a lot of new information and saw some really beautiful places. 
I would say that the trip was perfectly organzed and we felt very safe there.
reviews/19/text:
Booked a trip for December the 23rd 2019 and I was a little apprehensive due to the weather, but turned out just fine and off we went.
A little breezy to say the least so take a jacket lol
Our Skipper was Jamie, whom is full of knowledge about Olhao and the surrounding Islands.
He will tell you everything you want to know and more if you let him, if you want quiet time just tell him to Sssssh LOL
Joking apart, it was a great trip from begining to end and Jamie was a pure Gent.
Especially as I had my 78 year old Mother with me, whom he escorted on the Island of Culatra were they walked and talked about many things whilst the sun shone down upon us.
I would totally recccomend using Sabino Tours whilst visiting Olhao and for Myself I am looking forward to returning in March 2020 to learn more about this wonderful City and it's history
subcategory_ranking: #48 of 485 Boat Tours & Water Sports in Algarve
